title: Finding Domain and Range from Graphs

content.problem: Find the domain and range of the function shown in the graph of a parabola opening downward with vertex at (2, 5) and x-intercepts at (0, 0) and (4, 0).
steps:
Step 1: To find the domain, look at all possible x-values on the graph.
The graph extends horizontally from x = 0 to x = 4.
So the domain is [0, 4].

Step 2: To find the range, look at all possible y-values on the graph.
The lowest y-value is 0 (at the x-intercepts).
The highest y-value is 5 (at the vertex).
So the range is [0, 5].
content.explanation: When finding domain and range from a graph, the domain is the set of all x-coordinates and the range is the set of all y-coordinates. For a parabola opening downward, the maximum y-value occurs at the vertex.

interactive.question: A function is graphed as a semicircle centered at the origin with radius 3, in the upper half of the coordinate plane. What is its range?
